content:
Who We Are # Building safe AI is a collaborative mission — it requires policymakers to set the guardrails, researchers to design transparent and interpretable models, and builders to launch applications that positively impact the people they serve.
AI@UNM is a student organization at the University of New Mexico dedicated to exploring artificial intelligence through three complementary lenses: technical development, entrepreneurship, and governance.
Our Mission # Build a community at UNM that enables people to participate in meaningful work Introduce people to the world of AI through the lenses of government, business, and academia Our Approach: Projects Are Our Medium of Learning # At AI@UNM, we don’t just study AI — we build with it, analyze it, and shape policy around it. Members work on projects spanning research, product development, and policy analysis:
Write a review paper on GPU export control Apply existing AI interpretability methods to new models and problems Create new model architectures Ship an AI product and pitch it to investors Develop policy proposals for adoption of AI at UNM or beyond Your idea goes here — we support member-driven initiatives Projects bring together people from different tracks, creating interdisciplinary teams that mirror how AI work happens in the real world.
Three Tracks # We organize our work across three flexible tracks. Members are encouraged to explore across tracks — there’s no requirement to stay in one lane.
Technical — Shrey Poshiya # The technical track focuses on understanding how AI systems work and building them from the ground up.
Understanding foundations of AI — research skills, create novel AI frameworks Train, Test, and Deploy Models — prepare for AI Engineer roles Hackathons, Datathons, and Competitions — from New Mexico to nationwide Startup — Younes Slaoui # The startup track turns AI capabilities into real products and businesses.
Ship AI products and showcase them in your portfolio Find co-founders and collaborators for your next venture Test startup fit — learn whether entrepreneurship is your path Governance — Sophia Finale # The governance track examines the policy, ethical, and societal dimensions of AI systems.
Write policy briefs, proposals, blog posts, and research — prepare for internships, grad school, and creating change Analyze policy and legislation — explore careers in law, government, and tech policy Attend conferences, workshops, and build networks — from Albuquerque to NYC, the Bay Area, and DC How We Work Together # Every Wednesday at 5pm — Farris Basement
10-20 min General news and presentations 30 min Vertical and interest groups meet separately 70-80 min Project collaboration (optional but encouraged) The first hour is core meeting time; the remaining hour-plus is optional project work. Weekly Luma invites keep you updated on times, locations, and special events.
Get Involved # Join our mailing list — get updates on meetings, events, and opportunities Subscribe to our Substack — project showcases and AI analysis Show up on Wednesdays — the best way to get involved is to come to a meeting Questions? Reach out to any of our track leads or come find us at Farris Basement on Wednesday at 5pm.
title: About AI@UNM

content:
Building safe AI is a collaborative mission — it requires policymakers, researchers, and builders working together. AI@UNM brings students across disciplines to learn, build, and shape the future of AI through hands-on projects and real-world collaboration.
Get Involved # Learn More About Us Join Our Community Read Our Substack Upcoming Events # Every Wednesday at 5pm — Farris Basement
